objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Cone Nebula

Description The Cone nebula (LDN 1613) is a dark, cone-like feature to the right of center. The center has a brighter, reddish emission nebula called NGC 2264 or the fox fur nebula. The whole complex of star clusters and nebula is called the Christmas Tree nebula. Atik CCD in RGB filters on the 80 mm apo refractor. The red line is a satellite trail.

Original Date 3/13/12, 12:00 AM

Make Atik

Camera 383L
objects.title: Cone Nebula

objects.thumbCaption:
Messier 27 - red filter.
Messier 27, the Dumbell Nebula in Vulpecula. This is an image taken through the R (green) filter of the Atik CCD camera on the Celestron C11. Quickly blink…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Messier 27 - red filter.

Description Messier 27, the Dumbell Nebula in Vulpecula. This is an image taken through the R (green) filter of the Atik CCD camera on the Celestron C11. Quickly blink between the G and R image to see that different regions of the nebula brighten. This is because some regions have stronger [OIII] emission lines (which are green) and some regions have stronger H-alpha emission (which is red).

Original Date 9/19/14, 12:00 AM

Make Atik

Camera 383L
objects.title: Messier 27 - red filter.

Quickly blink between the G and R image to see that different regions of the nebula brighten. This is because some regions have stronger [OIII] emission lines (which are green) and some regions have stronger H-alpha emission (which is red).

objects.creator: JCP
objects.thumbCaption:
Flame and Horsehead Nebulae
The Flame Nebula and Horsehead Nebula are two nebulae in the Orion Molecular Complex. The Flame Nebula is in the lower center, and the Horsehead Nebula is to…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Flame and Horsehead Nebulae

Description The Flame Nebula and Horsehead Nebula are two nebulae in the Orion Molecular Complex. The Flame Nebula is in the lower center, and the Horsehead Nebula is to the center right. The bright blue star in the image is Alnitak, the leftmost star on Orion's belt. Taken with an Atik 343L CCD and an 80mm Meade apochromatic refractor. A reversed color palatte is used with green assigned to red, otherwise the horsehead would look red.

Date/Time 2012:03:22 11:12:09
objects.title: Flame and Horsehead Nebulae
objects.imageCaption:
Flame and Horsehead Nebulae
The Flame Nebula and Horsehead Nebula are two nebulae in the Orion Molecular Complex. The Flame Nebula is in the lower center, and the Horsehead Nebula is to the center right. The bright blue star in the image is Alnitak, the leftmost star on Orion's belt.
Taken with an Atik 343L CCD and an 80mm Meade apochromatic refractor. A reversed color palatte is used with green assigned to red, otherwise the horsehead would look red.

Taken with an Atik 343L CCD and an 80mm Meade apochromatic refractor.  A reversed color palatte is used with green assigned to red, otherwise the horsehead would look red.

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title The Horsehead nebula and Alnitak

Description The bright star Alnitak (below center) is one of the three stars in the belt of Orion. Just to its right is the Flame Nebula, and above it is the Horsehead Nebula. The Horsehead is created by a dust cloud blocking the light from the background, red nebulosity.

Original Date 3/4/18, 12:00 AM

Make Atik

Camera 383L

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title M76, the Little Dumbell.

Description M76, the Little Dumbbell nebula. Named after M27, the Dumbbell Nebula, which has a similar appearance. Both are planetary nebulas, the remnants of stars that have finished fusing helium into carbon but were not massive enough to go supernova. Atik CCD on Celestron C11.

Date/Time 2023:01:05 16:34:58

Messier 42 in Orion's belt
Messier 42, or the Great Orion Nebula, in Orion's belt. This is a "deeper" exposure bringing out more of the faint nebulosity. The bluish reflection nebula…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Messier 42 in Orion's belt

Description Messier 42, or the Great Orion Nebula, in Orion's belt. This is a "deeper" exposure bringing out more of the faint nebulosity. The bluish reflection nebula above M42 is NGC 1975. North is up and East to left. Taken with the Atik 383L+ CCD through RGB filters on the Meade 80 mm refractor.

Original Date 1/3/22, 12:00 AM

Make Atik

Camera 383L

objects.photodata:
Title M57

Description M57, the Ring Nebula in Lyra. This is one of the brightest and best known of the planetary nebulas. These nebulas are stars which have ejected their outer atmospheres and left a hot white dwarf core behind. Taken with the Meade DSI II on the 80mm apo.
